decks.notes: The key concept of this deck is to generate large amounts of mana using the UrzaTron lands (Urza's Mine, Urza's Tower, Urza's Power Plant) and color fixing artifacts (Chromatic Star, Chromatic Sphere) to cast powerful control spells. The deck focuses on controlling the board and disrupting the opponent's strategy with cards like Oblivion Stone and Walking Ballista, while also using cards like Sylvan Scrying and Expedition Map to search for key lands. Additionally, the deck has powerful threats like Wurmcoil Engine, Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger, and Ugin, the Spirit Dragon to close out the game.

The main goal of this deck is to assemble Urza's Mine, Urza's Power Plant, and Urza's Tower to generate a large amount of mana and play powerful threats such as Karn Liberated, Ugin, the Spirit Dragon, and Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger. With strong control elements like Oblivion Stone and Relic of Progenitus to disrupt the opponent's game plan, this deck aims to quickly ramp into big threats and overpower the opponent. The deck also includes card draw spells like Ancient Stirrings and Sylvan Scrying to help find the pieces needed to assemble the Tron lands.

The deck focuses on generating a critical mass of mana through spells like Pyretic Ritual and Desperate Ritual, then utilizing card draw and selection spells like Serum Visions and Opt to find key combo pieces like Gifts Ungiven and Past in Flames. By casting multiple cheap spells in one turn, the deck can generate a large storm count and finish the game with a powerful Grapeshot or a swarm of goblin tokens from Empty the Warrens. Baral, Chief of Compliance and Goblin Electromancer help reduce the cost of spells, making it easier to go off in a single turn.

The main concept of this Aggro - Death's Shadow deck is to aggressively reduce one's own life total to make Death's Shadow a powerful and cost-effective threat. The deck includes a mix of cheap and efficient removal spells, hand disruption, and card draw to support the aggressive gameplay. The inclusion of Gurmag Angler as an additional big threat helps to close out games quickly. Lastly, Snapcaster Mage is used to provide versatility by allowing players to reuse key spells from the graveyard.

The key strategy of this deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with instants and sorceries, enabling Arclight Phoenix to be cast from the graveyard for free. Additionally, utilizing cards like Faithless Looting and Thought Scour helps to dig through the deck and find the Phoenix. The deck also includes other strong threats like Thing in the Ice and Crackling Drake to pressure the opponent. With a low mana curve and efficient card draw, this deck aims to outpace and overwhelm the opponent with aggressive plays and powerful creatures.

The main focus of this deck is to assemble the Twin Exarch combo, utilizing Deceiver Exarch and Kiki-Jiki, Mirror Breaker to create infinite token copies of Deceiver Exarch for a game-winning attack. The deck also includes a variety of control elements such as counterspells, removal spells, and card advantage to protect the combo and disrupt the opponent's game plan. Jace, the Mind Sculptor provides additional card selection and control options, helping to ensure the combo can be assembled efficiently and safely.

This deck focuses on assembling and utilizing the Krark-Clan Ironworks combo to generate mana and draw cards. By sacrificing artifacts and looping them back with cards like Scrap Trawler and Myr Retriever, the deck can generate infinite mana and draw its entire library. The deck includes various artifacts to help with card draw and mana generation, as well as additional win conditions like Sai, Master Thopterist. The goal is to assemble the combo pieces quickly to overwhelm the opponent and win the game in a single turn.

The main concept of this deck is to aggressively play high-powered creatures like Death's Shadow and Gurmag Angler while disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Inquisition of Kozilek and Thoughtseize. Utilizing powerful spells like Stubborn Denial and Temur Battle Rage to protect and enhance your creatures, while also using cantrips like Thought Scour and Mishra's Bauble to dig for key cards. The deck aims to quickly lower its own life total to pump up Death's Shadow and Gurmag Angler while maintaining control of the board and applying pressure to the opponent.

The main focus of this deck is to efficiently generate mana and draw cards using artifacts like Terrarion, Mind Stone, and Ichor Wellspring. By sacrificing these artifacts with Krark-Clan Ironworks, players can trigger Scrap Trawler's ability to bring back key pieces from the graveyard and continue the combo. This synergy allows for explosive turns where players can generate massive amounts of mana and draw through their deck quickly, setting up for a win condition using cards like Sai, Master Thopterist or a large Pyrite Spellbomb finish.

The primary focus of this deck is to quickly bring out powerful creatures like Death's Shadow and Gurmag Angler by leveraging life loss mechanics like Street Wraith and Thoughtseize. Additionally, the deck includes various spells like Stubborn Denial and removal cards like Fatal Push and Lightning Bolt to control the board and protect its creatures. The inclusion of cards like Mishra's Bauble and Serum Visions ensures card draw and consistency, while cards like Snapcaster Mage offer versatility and the ability to reuse key spells. Overall, the deck aims to apply pressure early and maintain control throughout the game.

This deck aims to quickly fill the graveyard with cards to enable the powerful Arclight Phoenix to be brought back from the graveyard for massive damage. It uses a combination of cheap spells like Gut Shot and Lightning Bolt to deal damage while also cycling through the deck with cards like Serum Visions and Faithless Looting to find key pieces. The inclusion of Crackling Drake and Thing in the Ice provide additional threats and potential win conditions, making it a fast-paced and aggressive deck that can overwhelm opponents.

This deck is an aggressive human tribal deck that focuses on playing creatures quickly and efficiently. The key concept is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast, proactive strategy. The deck utilizes cards like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Meddling Mage to disrupt the opponent's game plan, while creatures like Champion of the Parish and Thalia's Lieutenant grow in power as more humans enter the battlefield. With efficient and evasive creatures like Mantis Rider and Kitesail Freebooter, the deck aims to quickly reduce the opponent's life total and win the game.

This deck focuses on generating mana and card advantage through artifacts like Terrarion, Mox Opal, and Ichor Wellspring, while utilizing Krark-Clan Ironworks to sacrifice them for more resources. By looping Scrap Trawler and Myr Retriever with the help of Sai, Master Thopterist, players can generate infinite mana and draw their entire deck, eventually finishing off opponents with Engineered Explosives or Pyrite Spellbomb. The key strategy is to assemble the combo pieces quickly and efficiently to overwhelm opponents before they can mount a defense.

This deck focuses on controlling the opponent's board and resources through counter spells, removal, and board wipes. It aims to stall the game and outvalue the opponent by generating card advantage with cards like Search for Azcanta and Ancestral Vision. The win condition is typically through card advantage and powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Jace, the Mind Sculptor. The deck aims to manipulate the game to its advantage, disrupting the opponent's game plan while slowly building up its own resources for a decisive victory.

The deck focuses on casting cards that allow for quick and efficient ways to fill the graveyard with Arclight Phoenixes and other spells, while also providing removal and control options. By combining low-cost spells and cantrips, it aims to quickly reduce the opponent's life total and pressure them with powerful flying threats like Arclight Phoenix and Crackling Drake. The deck utilizes a mix of burn spells, card draw, and graveyard recursion to maintain a steady stream of threats and disrupt the opponent's game plan.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly fill up the graveyard with instants and sorceries, enabling the Arclight Phoenix to be brought back from the graveyard for additional damage. The deck focuses on high aggression and quick spells, utilizing cards like Faithless Looting and Thought Scour to quickly cycle through the deck. Crackling Drake and Thing in the Ice provide additional threats on the board, while Lightning Bolt and Gut Shot help control the opponent's creatures. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a relentless assault of spells and creatures.

This deck focuses on assembling Urza's Tower, Power Plant, and Mine to generate large amounts of mana and cast powerful colorless spells. It utilizes control elements such as Karn Liberated, Ugin, the Spirit Dragon, and Oblivion Stone to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck also has search and ramp cards like Expedition Map, Sylvan Scrying, and Chromatic Star to find its key pieces quickly. With a strong endgame plan of casting massive threats like Wurmcoil Engine, Ulamog, and World Breaker, this deck aims to outvalue and overwhelm the opponent.

The key concept of this deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with Dredge cards using cards like Shriekhorn and Faithless Looting, then use Life from the Loam to bring back lands and trigger cards like Creeping Chill and Prized Amalgam. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a constant stream of recursion from the graveyard, utilizing cards like Conflagrate for direct damage and disruption. The synergy between graveyard recursion and powerful creatures like Bloodghast and Narcomoeba allows for explosive plays and quick victories.

The deck revolves around using Amulet of Vigor to generate extra mana and take advantage of lands that provide multiple benefits when they enter or leave the battlefield. By utilizing cards like Primeval Titan and Azusa, Lost but Seeking, the deck can quickly ramp up to play large threats like Walking Ballista and Engineered Explosives. The key strategy is to efficiently tutor for the necessary pieces using cards like Tolaria West and Ancient Stirrings, while also having protection in the form of Pact of Negation. Overall, the deck aims to assemble its combo pieces to overwhelm the opponent with powerful threats.

The key focus of this deck is to quickly and efficiently generate mana using cards like Desperate Ritual and Manamorphose, while also reducing the cost of spells with Goblin Electromancer and Baral, Chief of Compliance. By cycling through the deck with cards like Serum Visions and Sleight of Hand, the player can dig for key combo pieces like Grapeshot and Empty the Warrens. The deck aims to storm off and cast multiple spells in a single turn to deal lethal damage to the opponent. Using Gifts Ungiven to tutor for important cards and Past in Flames to recur spells from the graveyard are also crucial elements of the deck's strategy.
